result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffery Aaron Polcyn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Lewd, Lascivious Behavior-Exposure, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 944.20(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment OR attend school full-time, may be a combination of both to equal 40 hours per week. - Stayed until November.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. No contact with the Walmart on Oaks Rd or Stuart McBride Park or the Pick-N-Save parking lot near the park. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

Pay all court costs and supervision fees. $200 DNA surcharge assessed. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffery Aaron Polcyn

defendant.name: Polcyn, Jeffery Aaron
defendant.address: N3155 County Road H, Lake Geneva, WI 53147

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on August 29, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with Stuart McBride Park or any Park. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

1:53 PM Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jeffery Aaron Polcyn in court, in custody.  Attorney Alexander Lee Hahn in court for Jeffery Aaron Polcyn. Court Reporter:  Amy Schneider. 
Matter is scheduled on Defense's Motion to modify bond.
Defense is requesting that bond be amended to a $1000 signature bond.
State objects to any bond modification.
BTC: Will modify bond to a $1000 signature bond, Deft is to have not contact with any Park, all other conditions remain, matter adjourned.
Bail/bond hearing on July 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
